description: Curated offline PDF survival resource library for Project NOMAD

categories.name: Survival
categories.description: General survival skills, wilderness survival, and emergency preparedness fundamentals

categories.name: Medicine & First Aid
categories.description: Medical knowledge, first aid, field medicine, and health care without professional facilities

categories.name: Preparedness & Planning
categories.description: Emergency planning, checklists, bug-out preparation, and disaster readiness

categories.name: Military Manuals
categories.description: Military field manuals covering tactics, fieldcraft, and combat skills

categories.name: Nuclear / CBRN
categories.description: Nuclear, chemical, biological, and radiological threat preparation and response

categories.name: Food & Agriculture
categories.description: Food preservation, farming, foraging, hunting, trapping, and food storage

categories.name: DIY & Repair
categories.description: Construction, repair, maintenance, and improvised solutions

categories.name: Education & Reference
categories.description: General knowledge, educational materials, and reference guides

categories.name: Navigation & Communication
categories.description: Map reading, compass use, land navigation, signaling, and radio communication

categories.name: Self-Defense & Security
categories.description: Personal defense, martial arts, security, and protective measures

categories.name: Shelter & Construction
categories.description: Building shelters, fortifications, and emergency structures

categories.name: Water & Sanitation
categories.description: Water purification, hygiene, sanitation, and waste management

categories.name: Computing & Technology
categories.description: Technical references for computing, electronics, radio, and technology

categories.name: Quick Reference
categories.description: Checklists, charts, quick-reference cards, and printable guides

items.title: 1881 Household Cyclopedia
items.summary: 1881 Household Cyclopedia. A massive 710-page Victorian-era reference covering nearly every aspect of domestic life including agriculture, food preservation, brewing, dyeing, medicine, metalworking, masonry, paints, and hundreds of practical recipes and techniques. An invaluable DIY knowledge base. 14.17 MB.

items.title: FM 4-25.11 First Aid
items.summary: U.S. Army field manual for first aid procedures including casualty evaluation, breathing restoration, bleeding control, shock prevention, fracture treatment, burns care, heat/cold injuries, and field-expedient bandaging. Essential medical reference for emergency situations.

items.title: NAVMED P-5010 USN Manual of Preventive Medicine
items.summary: U.S. Navy guide covering disease prevention, sanitation, pest control, food safety, water quality, occupational health, and field hygiene. Essential for maintaining health in austere or group-living conditions.

items.title: ST 31-91B Special Forces Medical Handbook
items.summary: Comprehensive U.S. Army Special Forces medical reference covering emergency assessment, trauma care, pharmacology, disease diagnosis, veterinary medicine, dental emergencies, OB/GYN, pediatrics, and preventive medicine. One of the most thorough military medical handbooks available.
content_duplicate_of: US Army Special Forces Medical Handbook ST 31-91B

items.title: Survival First Aid Kit Checklist
items.summary: Comprehensive checklist for assembling a survival-oriented first aid kit including trauma supplies, medications, wound care, and improvised medical tools.

items.title: Survival and Austere Medicine
items.summary: Community-authored guide to practicing medicine when modern healthcare is unavailable. Covers wound management, fractures, infections, chronic disease management, improvised equipment, dental care, anesthesia, and pharmaceutical alternatives. Highly practical for long-term grid-down scenarios.

items.title: US Army Special Forces Medical Handbook ST 31-91B
items.summary: Alternate edition of the Special Forces Medical Handbook. Comprehensive military medical reference covering emergency treatment, trauma surgery, pharmacology, disease management, and preventive medicine across 407 pages. Larger file size edition with clearer formatting.

items.title: Where There is No Doctor
items.summary: Comprehensive 503-page village health care handbook by David Werner, widely regarded as the most important medical reference for situations without professional healthcare access. Covers diagnostics, common diseases, wounds, childbirth, nutrition, preventive care, and when to seek help. Used worldwide by aid organizations.

items.title: Nuclear Survival Kit Checklist
items.summary: Quick-reference checklist for assembling a nuclear event survival kit including radiation detection, shelter supplies, decontamination materials, and communication equipment.

items.title: Nuclear War Survival Skills by Cresson Kearny
items.summary: The definitive civilian guide to surviving nuclear war, authored by Oak Ridge National Laboratory researcher Cresson Kearny. Covers blast/fallout protection, improvised shelters, ventilation, water/food storage, radiation measurement, and post-attack recovery across 317 pages. Essential reading for nuclear preparedness.

items.title: Basic Emergency Plan
items.summary: Concise emergency planning template for families and individuals to document evacuation routes, meeting points, emergency contacts, and critical procedures.

items.title: Bug Out Bag Checklist
items.summary: Detailed checklist for building a 72-hour evacuation bag covering shelter, water filtration, fire-making, food, first aid, navigation, communication, and personal documents.

items.title: Dog Bug Out Bag Checklist
items.summary: Checklist for preparing an evacuation kit for dogs including food, water, medications, identification, leash/carrier, and comfort items.

items.title: FEMA Citizen Preparedness Guide
items.summary: Official FEMA guide for individual and family emergency preparedness covering risk assessment, emergency kits, communication plans, shelter-in-place procedures, and evacuation planning across multiple disaster types.

items.title: Flood Survival Kit Checklist
items.summary: Specialized checklist for flood disaster preparation including water barriers, waterproof storage, evacuation supplies, and recovery essentials.

items.title: Home Survival Kit Checklist
items.summary: Practical checklist for assembling a comprehensive home emergency kit covering water, food, first aid, tools, communication, lighting, and sanitation supplies.

items.title: Hurricane Survival Kit Checklist
items.summary: Hurricane-specific emergency kit checklist covering wind protection, water supply, communication backup, structural reinforcement, and evacuation readiness.

items.title: Kids Bug Out Bag Checklist
items.summary: Age-appropriate evacuation bag checklist for children including comfort items, identification, simplified survival supplies, and medical information.

items.title: 3 Day Emergency Prep
items.summary: Practical 3-day emergency preparedness guide covering essential supplies, water storage, food preparation, first aid basics, communication plans, and shelter-in-place procedures.

items.title: Bug Out Vehicle Checklist

items.title: Down But Not Out - Canadian Survival Manual
items.summary: Canadian Armed Forces survival manual covering Arctic, temperate, and wilderness survival including shelter construction, fire-making, water procurement, food sources, navigation, and rescue signaling. Adapted for Canadian geography and climate extremes.

items.title: FM 21-76 US Army Survival Manual
items.summary: The definitive U.S. Army survival field manual covering psychology of survival, planning, basic medicine, shelter construction, water procurement, fire-making, food foraging, weapons and tools, desert/tropical/cold weather/sea survival, navigation, and signaling. The gold standard reference for military and civilian wilderness survival.

items.title: FM 21-76-1 Survival Evasion Recovery
items.summary: Alternate edition of the U.S. military survival, evasion, and recovery manual covering SERE principles, fieldcraft, navigation, sustenance, and evader conduct. Duplicate content to FM 21-76-1 from trueprepper.

items.title: FM 21-76-1 Survival Evasion and Recovery
items.summary: U.S. military multiservice guide covering survival, evasion, resistance, and escape (SERE) procedures. Includes navigation without instruments, shelter and fire techniques, water and food procurement, evasion planning, and recovery operations. Companion to FM 21-76.

items.title: Montana Winter Survival Manual
items.summary: State-published winter survival guide focused on cold weather vehicle emergencies, hypothermia prevention, shelter building in snow, fire-making in wet conditions, and winter-specific survival priorities.

items.title: FM 21-10 Field Hygiene and Sanitation
items.summary: U.S. Army manual on maintaining health and hygiene in field conditions. Covers water purification, waste disposal, personal hygiene, pest management, food sanitation, and disease prevention. Critical for any scenario involving group survival.

items.title: Where There is No Dentist
items.summary: Practical dental care guide for situations without access to professional dentistry. Covers tooth anatomy, common dental problems, pain management, tooth extraction, oral hygiene, and preventive dental care using available materials.
